CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and taken into police custody on suspicion of membership of an illegal organisation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant 's detention on remand .

CARDINAL . On DATE the public prosecutor 's office at FAC filed a bill of indictment with the latter , accusing the applicant of membership of an illegal organisation . The public prosecutor 's office requested that the applicant be convicted and sentenced under LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicant as charged and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . Before ORG , the applicant was tried together with CARDINAL co - suspects .
CARDINAL . Following the applicant 's appeal , his case was referred to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of ORG on the ground that latter had misinterpreted the domestic law in respect of the offence in question .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was released from detention .
CARDINAL . Subsequent to promulgation of PERSON no . CARDINAL on DATE , which abolished the jurisdiction of ORG , ORG acquired jurisdiction over the applicant 's case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held that the offence fell within the scope of LAW and consequently the statutory timelimit under LAW and ORG of LAW had expired . It accordingly ordered that the criminal proceedings against the applicant be terminated .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment became final in respect of the applicant .
CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law and practice can be found in Şahiner v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL-IX .
